data.message: It sounds so much better using the j sound!  Plus, I'm sure there are other acronyms that use a different pronunciation for a letter than the word it represents.

replies.message: na
It's /dʒ/ sound actually. :)
Gif like jif makes me think of peanut butter.
Ericka: Thats the point, actually. The "slogan" the creator had for the file was "Choosy developers choose GIF."

But the acronym stands for graphics interchange format. It's a hard g not a j. Like graphic designer. Which I am. And have been for over 20 years. It's never been called a jif until the past few years to spark internet outrage debate. You can call it what you want but it stands for graphics.

Thats where you're wrong, kiddo. First of all, it started out being pronounced with a soft g, as the creator did that. His whole "slogan" for the format was "Choosy developers choose GIF." I've been around the internet since about the same time you apparently started your career, and it was pronounced with a soft g. Also, to your first point, the U in scuba stands for "underwater", but I'll bet you $50 you pronounced it "SKOO-buh" in your head.

Hans Farnbach there's no debate. G is for graphics. It's stupid. Slogans are fine. You don't say graphics like jraphics. So say it how you want. Bring up a thousand other words. Graphics is still said with a hard g. Even if it's a marketing point it's still a hard g.
The point is that it doesn't HAVE to use the same pronunciation as the word it represents.  There is no rule about acronyms that says so.

Anthony: So you say "skubba", " laa-SEER", "taa-SEER", "NAY-sa", "YOO-nih-cheef", "snaw-fuh", "fuh-bar"? Just because the letter in an acronym stands for a certain word doesn't mean it has to be pronounced that way.
José Gascó phonetics 😊

Just keep going. You're still wrong. Make up another excuse. It stands for graphics interchange format. Graphics has a hard g. It's not about the letter in the acronym so much as the letter in the acronym represents a word that begins with a hard g. The rest is marketing.
I feel like that "dev for 20 years" guy blocked me. I don't see his posts anymore. :D
Before I heard it said out loud, I just always said "G-I-F" 🤷‍♀️
But the pronunciation of the letter G itself is a soft sound, so between the two, I would "choose 'Jif'" 😂
But the giraffe calls them jer-aphics, so...🙌😉😂

Anthony, I cringe to your responses. Do you pronounce JPEG as jay-feg? Didn't think so. Your arguments are so wrong, it hurts. 

Thank you, Hans, not all heroes wear capes. 😄👍
This isn't peanut butter.

Sara: just because two things share the same pronunciation doesn't mean they are the same. Is a book that you've read necessarily reflective of light around the 560nm wavelength? When you blew out your candles, did you change their color? Homophones exist, and this one exists on purpose. "Choosy developers choose GIF" was the "slogan" the creator had for the new format.
No it doesn't
jajajajaja
Like the peanut butter?! All my years I've never heard anyone pronounce it that way
https://youtu.be/D7uVzK0vrfU
